clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Interest of a Systematic Screening for Oncological Supportive Care Needs
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Interest of a Systematic Screening for Oncological Supportive Care

brief_summary.textblock: Monocentric, descriptive, cross-sectional, interventional, prospective and non-randomized study.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study will unfold in the followed day hospital's departments of the Paul Strauss Cancer Center (Strasbourg, France) : supportive care department, chemiotherapy department and radiotherapy department. The study is based on two questionnaires that include six sections : nutrition, social, psychologic, physiotherapy, pain and supportive care needs evaluation.
The first questionnaire gives information about the patient and allow to screen supportive care needs. It should be read by medical or paramedical staff who report the function of the reader and options that are proposed to the patient after reading the questionnaire.
The second questionnaire will be done after 4 to 6 weeks by a phone call from the clinical research nurse. The objective of this questionnaire is to determine what kind of care have been provided.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of using oncological supportive cares after evaluation of supportive care needs reviewed by a professional of health, by a phone call
primary_outcome.description: Assess the percentage of using oncological supportive cares after evaluation of supportive care needs reviewed by a professional. The use of supportive cares is evaluated with an hetero-questionnaire created for this study. The hetero-questionnaire consists in a phone call to evaluate the evolution of each item of the self-assessment questionnaire (which includes 6 evaluations : a nutritional evaluation (10 items), a social evaluation (8 items), a psychologic evaluation (6 items), a physiological evaluation (7 items), a pain evaluation (4 items) and a supportive care needs evaluation (6 items)).

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of initial supportive care needs by the self-assessment questionnaire
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the percentage of initial supportive care needs evaluated by the self-assessment questionnaire created for this study. It includes evaluations : a nutritional evaluation (10 items), a social evaluation (8 items), a psychologic evaluation (6 items), a physiological evaluation (7 items), a pain evaluation (4 items) and a supportive care needs evaluation (6 items).

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the correlation between supportive care needs and age
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This analyse will be realized at the end of the study (9 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate the percentage of supportive care needs to age by a Pearson Chi squared test

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the correlation between supportive care needs and sexe
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This analyse will be realized at the end of the study (9 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate the percentage of supportive care needs to sexe by a Pearson Chi squared test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the correlation between supportive care needs and type of cancer
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This analyse will be realized at the end of the study (9 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate the percentage of supportive care needs to the type of cancer by a Pearson Chi squared test

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the percentage of using a supportive care professional judgement in regard to read and unread questionnaires by medical staff
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This analyse will be realized at the end of the study (9 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the percentage of using a supportive care when the medical staff read the completed questionnaire. Assess the percentage of using a supportive care when the medical staff didn't read the completed questionnaire. Then compare these values by using a T- test of Student.

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare the percentage of using a supportive care professional judgement in regard to the function of the medical staff member
secondary_outcome.time_frame: This analyse will be realized at the end of the study (9 weeks after baseline)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the percentage of using a supportive care when the medical staff who read the completed questionnaire is a doctor, a nurse, or an auxiliary nurse . Then compare these values by using a T- test of Student

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the percentage of requirement to the physician during the study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 to 6 weeks after baseline (by a phone call, at the same time than the hetero-questionnaire)
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the percentage of requirement to the physician during the study by asking each patient (by phone call)

arm_group.description: Questionnaire to assess the supportive care needs

intervention.description: Evaluation of interest of a systematic screening for oncological supportive care needs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient treated for a cancer
- Age ≥ 18 years old
- Receiving treatment (chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy) in day hospital and/or supportive care department
- Able to speak, read and understand French
- Able to communicate by phone
- Written informed consent obtained from the patient
- Registration in a national health care system
Exclusion Criteria:
- Minor or protected adult
- Pregnant or breastfeeding woman
